profile_positions.description:
Implemented research, M&E and planning activities on food security and livelihoods component of the USAID Feed the Future Initiative, IRRIP project in South and Central Tanzania. 
•	Research: Lead research activities for supporting FSL, household economics and nutrition in the Kilombero region. This includes research design, training of enumerators, coordination of field data collection for: (1) detailed livelihoods zoning study; (2) baseline livelihoods access study; (3) detailed agricultural livelihoods assessment; 
•	Team Management: Supervised 4 research assistants (master’s graduates) on their research and data management activities around food security, agri-based livelihoods, nutrition and household economics.
•	Capacity Development: Organized and facilitated training workshop and learning events on sustainable livelihoods framework, rapid rural appraisals, M&E and database management for staff, implementing partners and local civil servants.  
•	Monitoring and Evaluation: Developed M&E plan, frameworks, calendars and tools that fed into the projects PMP; coordinated quarterly field monitoring activities, lead quarterly monitoring meetings with IPs, prepared quarterly monitoring reports
•	Information Management:
Coordinated the set-up of a data-base with corresponding DBMS in conjunction with DBMS consultant for agricultural based livelihoods and nutrition data of the Southern Agricultural Growth Corridor of Tanzania SAGCOT.
profile_positions.title: Research and Monitoring Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Assignments carried out as CDP-Utrecht Monitoring and Research analyst for diverse clients including donors, NGOs and multilateral agencies in the African Great Lakes region. Working in this capacity, I conducted third party monitoring, external evaluations and research for humanitarian and rural development programs in Rwanda, Burundi and the DRC. 
•	Monitoring and Evaluation: Performed data collection, analysis and reporting for third party monitoring on donor funded projects in agricultural development, food security and sustainable livelihoods. 
•	Research: conducted pre-crisis market analysis; rapid needs assessments; detailed rapid appraisals; social return on investments analysis; cost-benefit analysis, detailed needs assessment studies (for small, medium and micro enterprise promotion).
•	Proposal writing: provided technical inputs on proposals for professional services in food security and livelihoods, economics and natural resource management.    
•	Reporting: prepared site monitoring reports, project evaluation reports, research papers and quarterly updates for clients.

profile_positions.description:
Day to day management of the Building an Inclusive East African Community (BIEAC) project under the supervision of CUTS-GRC director. Included but not limited to the following tasks:
1) Drafting BIEAC quarterly financial reports and annual narrative report to GIZ (Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit/German Society for International Cooperation).
2) Undertaking an extensive budget line reconciliation activity in preparation for final audit and preparing the final report to GIZ.
3) M&E of all BIEAC partner activities as well as ensuring that project deadlines and protocol are upheld.
4) Advising BIEAC partners on project activities
5) Managing the allocation and accounting of project funds
6) Compiling, editing and proofreading of all research papers from BIEAC project partners
7) Assisting project consultant and CUTS-GRC director in the preparation of final synthesis report for BIEAC research.
